input:
This book introduced Shakespeare to Ovid; it was a fine selection of his writing. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) Shakespeare
(B) Ovid

John hired Bill to take care of him . What does the pronoun "him" refer to?
(A) John
(B) Bill

John was doing research in the library when he heard a man humming and whistling. He was very annoyed. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) John
(B) The man

Grace was happy to trade me her sweater for my jacket. She thinks it looks dowdy on her. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The sweater
(B) The jacket

Alice tried frantically to stop her daughter from chatting at the party, leaving us to wonder why she was behaving so strangely. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Alice
(B) Alice's daughter

If the con artist has succeeded in fooling Sam, he would have gotten a lot of money. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) The con artist
(B) Sam

James asked Robert for a favor but he refused. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) James
(B) Robert

Bill passed the half-empty plate to John because he was hungry. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Bill
(B) John

Fred covered his eyes with his hands, because the wind was blowing sand around. He lowered them when the wind stopped. What does the pronoun "them" refer to?
(A) His eyes
(B) His hands

Tom gave Ralph a lift to school so he wouldn't have to drive alone. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Tom
(B) Ralph

Alice looked for her friend Jade in the crowd. Since she always has good luck, Alice spotted her quickly. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Alice
(B) Jade

Archaeologists have concluded that humans lived in Laputa 20,000 years ago. They hunted for evidence on the river banks. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) Archaeologists
(B) Prehistoric humans

I stuck a pin through a carrot. When I pulled the pin out, it left a hole. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The pin
(B) The carrot

Jane gave Joan candy because she wasn't hungry. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Jane
(B) Joan

Pam's parents came home and found her having sex with her boyfriend, Paul. They were furious about it. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) Pam's parents
(B) Pam and Paul

The path to the lake was blocked, so we couldn't reach it . What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The path
(B) The lake

Frank was upset with Tom because the toaster he had sold him didn't work. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Frank
(B) Tom

Since it was raining, I carried the newspaper over my backpack to keep it dry. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The newspaper
(B) The backpack

Billy cried because Toby wouldn't share his toy. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) Billy
(B) Toby

Susan knows all about Ann's personal problems because she is indiscreet. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Susan
(B) Ann

We had hoped to place copies of our newsletter on all the chairs in the auditorium, but there were simply not enough of them . What does the pronoun "them" refer to?
(A) copies of the newsletter
(B) chairs

Madonna fired her trainer because she slept with her boyfriend. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Madonna
(B) The trainer

As Ollie carried Tommy up the long winding steps, his legs ached. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) Ollie
(B) Tommy

Sara borrowed the book from the library because she needs it for an article she is working on. She writes it when she gets home from work. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The book
(B) The article

Bob paid for Charlie's college education. He is very generous. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) Bob
(B) Charlie

I saw Jim yelling at some guy in a military uniform with a huge red beard. I don't know why he was, but he looked very unhappy. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Jim
(B) the guy in uniform

Joan made sure to thank Susan for all the help she had given. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Joan
(B) Susan

The customer walked into the bank and stabbed one of the tellers. He was immediately taken to the hospital. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) The customer
(B) The teller

Pam's parents came home and found her having sex with her boyfriend, Paul. They were embarrassed about it. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) Pam's parents
(B) Pam and Paul

If the con artist has succeeded in fooling Sam, he would have lost a lot of money. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) The con artist
(B) Sam

We went to the lake, because a shark had been seen at the ocean beach, so it was a dangerous place to swim. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The lake
(B) The ocean beach

I used an old rag to clean the knife, and then I put it in the drawer. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The rag
(B) The knife

The father carried the sleeping boy in his arms What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) The father
(B) The boy

Fred watched TV while George went out to buy groceries. After an hour he got up. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Fred
(B) George

Tom threw his schoolbag down to Ray after he reached the bottom of the stairs. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Tom
(B) Ray

The older students were bullying the younger ones, so we punished them . What does the pronoun "them" refer to?
(A) The older students
(B) The younger students

There is a pillar between me and the stage, and I can't see around it . What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The pillar
(B) The stage

Billy cried because Toby wouldn't accept his toy. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) Billy
(B) Toby

The man couldn't lift his son because he was so heavy. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) The man
(B) The son

John ordered Bill to leave, so an hour later he left. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) John
(B) Bill

Sam's drawing was hung just above Tina's and it did look much better with another one above it. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) Sam's drawing
(B) Tina's drawing

The lawyer asked the witness a question, but he was reluctant to repeat it. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) the lawyer
(B) the witness

The painting in Mark's living room shows an oak tree. It is to the right of the bookcase. What does the pronoun "It" refer to?
(A) The painting
(B) The oak tree

When Tommy dropped his ice cream, Timmy giggled, so father gave him a stern look. What does the pronoun "him" refer to?
(A) Tommy
(B) Timmy

Susan knew that Ann's son had been in a car accident, because she told her about it. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Susan
(B) Ann

Thomson visited Cooper's grave in 1765. At that date he had been travelling for five years. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Thomson
(B) Cooper

Jim comforted Kevin because he was so upset. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Jim
(B) Kevin

We went to the lake, because a shark had been seen at the ocean beach, so it was a safer place to swim. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The lake
(B) The ocean beach

Dr. Adams informed Kate that she had cancer and presented several options for future treatment. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Dr. Adams
(B) Kate

Frank felt crushed when his longtime rival Bill revealed that he was the winner of the competition. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Frank
(B) Bill

Paul tried to call George on the phone, but he wasn't successful. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Paul
(B) George

Bob paid for Charlie's college education. He is very grateful. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) Bob
(B) Charlie

I couldn't put the pot on the shelf because it was too high. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The pot
(B) The shelf

Jim signaled the barman and gestured toward his bathroom key. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) Jim
(B) The barman

When the sponsors of the bill got to the town hall, they were surprised to find that the room was full of opponents. They were very much in the majority. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) The sponsors
(B) The opponents

Adam can't leave work here until Bob arrives to replace him. If Bob had left home for work on time, he would be gone by this time. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Adam
(B) Bob

The father carried the sleeping boy in his bassinet. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) The father
(B) The boy

During a game of tag, Ethan chased Luke because he was "it". What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Ethan
(B) Luke

Lily spoke to Donna, breaking her silence. What does the pronoun "her" refer to?
(A) Lily
(B) Donna

Adam can't leave work here until Bob arrives to replace him. If Bob had left home for work on time, he would be here by this time. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Adam
(B) Bob

Many people start to read Paul's books and can't put them down. They are popular because Paul writes so well. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) People
(B) Paul's books

The large ball crashed right through the table because it was made of steel. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The large ball
(B) The table

The foxes are getting in at night and attacking the chickens. They have gotten very nervous. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) The foxes
(B) The chickens

There is a gap in the wall. You can see the garden through it . What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The gap
(B) The wall

Frank felt vindicated when his longtime rival Bill revealed that he was the winner of the competition. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Frank
(B) Bill

I poured water from the bottle into the cup until it was full. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) the bottle
(B) the cup

John hired himself out to Bill to take care of him . What does the pronoun "him" refer to?
(A) John
(B) Bill

Sam pulled up a chair to the piano, but it was broken, so he had to sing instead. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The chair
(B) The piano

There is a pillar between me and the stage, and I can't see it . What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The pillar
(B) The stage

Ann asked Mary what time the library closes, because she had forgotten. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Ann
(B) Mary

This book introduced Shakespeare to Goethe; it was a major influence on his writing. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) Shakespeare
(B) Goethe

Jane knocked on Susan's door but she did not get an answer. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Jane
(B) Susan

The lawyer asked the witness a question, but he was reluctant to answer it. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) the lawyer
(B) the witness

I was trying to open the lock with the key, but someone had filled the keyhole with chewing gum, and I couldn't get it in. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The key
(B) The chewing gum

Anne gave birth to a daughter last month. She is a very charming woman. What does the pronoun "She" refer to?
(A) Anne
(B) Anne's daughter

I stuck a pin through a carrot. When I pulled the pin out, it had a hole. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The pin
(B) The carrot

Mark told Pete many lies about himself, which Pete included in his book. He should have been more truthful. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) Mark
(B) Pete

Everyone really loved the oatmeal cookies; only a few people liked the chocolate chip cookies. Next time, we should make fewer of them . What does the pronoun "them" refer to?
(A) The oatmeal cookies
(B) The chocolate chip cookies

Sam took French classes from Adam, because he was eager to speak it fluently. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Sam
(B) Adam

Bob paid for Charlie's college education, but now Charlie acts as though it never happened. He is very hurt. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) Bob
(B) Charlie

Tom gave Ralph a lift to school so he wouldn't have to walk. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Tom
(B) Ralph

Sam broke both his ankles and he's walking with crutches. But a month or so from now they should be unnecessary. What does the pronoun "they" refer to?
(A) The ankles
(B) The crutches

Ann asked Mary what time the library closes, but she had forgotten. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Ann
(B) Mary

The sun was covered by a thick cloud all morning, but luckily, by the time the picnic started, it was gone. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The sun
(B) The cloud

At the Loebner competition the judges couldn't figure out which respondents were the chatbots because they were so stupid. What does the pronoun "they" refer to?
(A) the judges
(B) the chatbots

John was jogging through the park when he saw a man juggling watermelons. He was very impressed. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) John
(B) The juggler

George got free tickets to the play, but he gave them to Eric, because he was not particularly eager to see it. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) George
(B) Eric

Steve follows Fred's example in everything. He admires him hugely. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) Steve
(B) Fred

This morning, Joey built a sand castle on the beach, and put a toy flag in the highest tower, but this afternoon the wind knocked it down. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The sand castle
(B) The flag

The older students were bullying the younger ones, so we rescued them . What does the pronoun "them" refer to?
(A) The older students
(B) The younger students

Fred is the only man still alive who remembers my great-grandfather. He was a remarkable man. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) Fred
(B) My great-grandfather

Sam tried to paint a picture of shepherds with sheep, but they ended up looking more like golfers. What does the pronoun "they" refer to?
(A) The shepherds
(B) The sheep

Anna did a lot worse than her good friend Lucy on the test because she had studied so hard. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Anna
(B) Lucy

The sun was covered by a thick cloud all morning, but luckily, by the time the picnic started, it was out. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The sun
(B) The cloud

The man lifted the boy onto his bunk bed. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) The man
(B) The boy

In the storm, the tree fell down and crashed through the roof of my house. Now, I have to get it removed. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The tree
(B) The roof

The painting in Mark's living room shows an oak tree. It is to the right of a house. What does the pronoun "It" refer to?
(A) The painting
(B) The oak tree

I couldn't find a spoon, so I tried using a pen to stir my coffee. But that turned out to be a bad idea, because it got full of coffee. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The pen
(B) The coffee

The actress used to be named Terpsichore, but she changed it to Tina a few years ago, because she figured it was too hard to pronounce. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) Terpsichore
(B) Tina

As Andrea in the crop duster passed over Susan, she could see the landing gear. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Andrea
(B) Susan

Jim yelled at Kevin because he was so upset. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Jim
(B) Kevin

The trophy doesn't fit into the brown suitcase because it is too large. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) the trophy
(B) the suitcase

Jane knocked on Susan's door but she did not answer. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Jane
(B) Susan

Bob was playing cards with Adam and was way ahead. If Adam hadn't had a sudden run of good luck, he would have lost. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Bob
(B) Adam

Fred and Alice had very warm down coats, but they were not enough for the cold in Alaska. What does the pronoun "they" refer to?
(A) Fred and Alice
(B) coats

I was trying to open the lock with the key, but someone had filled the keyhole with chewing gum, and I couldn't get it out. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The key
(B) The chewing gum

They broadcast an announcement, but a subway came into the station and I couldn't hear it . What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The announcement
(B) The subway

Jackson was greatly influenced by Arnold, though he lived two centuries earlier. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Jackson
(B) Arnold

This book introduced Shakespeare to Goethe; it was a fine selection of his writing. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) Shakespeare
(B) Goethe

Jane knocked on Susan's door, but there was no answer. She was out. What does the pronoun "She" refer to?
(A) Jane
(B) Susan

Anna did a lot better than her good friend Lucy on the test because she had studied so hard. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Anna
(B) Lucy

John was doing research in the library when he heard a man humming and whistling. He was very annoying. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) John
(B) The man

Dan had to stop Bill from toying with the injured bird. He is very cruel. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) Dan
(B) Bill

The cat was lying by the mouse hole waiting for the mouse, but it was too cautious. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The cat
(B) The mouse

The man couldn't lift his son because he was so weak. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) The man
(B) The son

I used an old rag to clean the knife, and then I put it in the trash. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The rag
(B) The knife

Bill passed the gameboy to John because his turn was over. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) Bill
(B) John

The drain is clogged with hair. It has to be cleaned. What does the pronoun "It" refer to?
(A) The drain
(B) The hair

The sculpture rolled off the shelf because it wasn't anchored. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The sculpture
(B) The shelf

Joe paid the detective after he received the final report on the case. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Joe
(B) the detective

Alice tried frantically to stop her daughter from barking at the party, leaving us to wonder why she was behaving so strangely. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Alice
(B) Alice's daughter

Mark told Pete many lies about himself, which Pete included in his book. He should have been more skeptical. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) Mark
(B) Pete

Joe has sold his house and bought a new one a few miles away. He will be moving into it on Thursday. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The old house
(B) The new house

Dan took the rear seat while Bill claimed the front because his "Dibs!" was quicker. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) Dan
(B) Bill

Sam took French classes from Adam, because he was known to speak it fluently. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Sam
(B) Adam

Sara borrowed the book from the library because she needs it for an article she is working on. She reads it when she gets home from work. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The book
(B) The article

Emma did not pass the ball to Janie although she was open. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Emma
(B) Janie

It was a summer afternoon, and the dog was sitting in the middle of the lawn. After a while, it got up and moved to a spot under the tree, because it was hot. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The dog
(B) The spot under the tree

In the middle of the outdoor concert, the rain started falling, but it continued until 10. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The concert
(B) The rain

We had hoped to place copies of our newsletter on all the chairs in the auditorium, but there were simply too many of them . What does the pronoun "them" refer to?
(A) copies of the newsletter
(B) chairs

When Tommy dropped his ice cream, Timmy giggled, so father gave him a sympathetic look. What does the pronoun "him" refer to?
(A) Tommy
(B) Timmy

I put the cake away in the refrigerator. It has a lot of butter in it. What does the pronoun "It" refer to?
(A) The cake
(B) The refrigerator

The fish ate the worm. It was hungry. What does the pronoun "It" refer to?
(A) The fish
(B) The worm

Bob collapsed on the sidewalk. Soon he saw Carl coming to help. He was very ill. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) Bob
(B) Carl

Pete envies Martin although he is very successful. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Pete
(B) Martin

The table won't fit through the doorway because it is too narrow. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The table
(B) The doorway

Patting her back, the woman smiled at the girl. What does the pronoun "her" refer to?
(A) The woman
(B) The girl

In the middle of the outdoor concert, the rain started falling, and it continued until 10. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The concert
(B) The rain

In the storm, the tree fell down and crashed through the roof of my house. Now, I have to get it repaired. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The tree
(B) The roof

The city councilmen refused the demonstrators a permit because they advocated violence. What does the pronoun "they" refer to?
(A) The city councilmen
(B) The demonstrators

Archaeologists have concluded that humans lived in Laputa 20,000 years ago. They hunted for deer on the river banks. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) Archaeologists
(B) Prehistoric humans

Madonna fired her trainer because she couldn't stand her boyfriend. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Madonna
(B) The trainer

Fred and Alice had very warm down coats, but they were not prepared for the cold in Alaska. What does the pronoun "they" refer to?
(A) Fred and Alice
(B) coats

Kirilov ceded the presidency to Shatov because he was more popular. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Kirilov
(B) Shatov

Jane knocked on Susan's door, but there was no answer. She was disappointed. What does the pronoun "She" refer to?
(A) Jane
(B) Susan

John couldn't see the stage with Billy in front of him because he is so short. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) John
(B) Billy

The journalists interviewed the stars of the new movie. They were very cooperative, so the interview lasted for a long time. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) The journalists
(B) The stars

The foxes are getting in at night and attacking the chickens. They have gotten very bold. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) The foxes
(B) The chickens

The drain is clogged with hair. It has to be removed. What does the pronoun "It" refer to?
(A) The drain
(B) The hair

Joe paid the detective after he delivered the final report on the case. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Joe
(B) the detective
